ABOUT

I am a PhD candidate in Statistical Methods in Economics at the University of Salerno. My current research focuses on the development and empirical application of Score-Driven Time-Varying Parameter Models, State-Space Models, and volatility modeling using high-frequency data in macroeconomics and finance. My primary empirical interests include estimating latent macroeconomic components—such as risk attitudes and uncertainty—the interaction between financial and real sectors, the quantitative analysis of speculative bubbles in housing and stock markets, and studying monetary policy transmission mechanisms and inflation dynamics. Moving forward, I plan to extend my research by incorporating Structural Vector Autoregressive (SVAR) models and Quantile Regression techniques to advance the methodological toolkit in empirical macro-finance and deepen the understanding of dynamic economic relationships.

ACADEMIC BIOI completed my Master’s degree in International Business while working in the private sector in Kraków, Poland, gaining practical experience in financial analysis within an international environment. I began my PhD studies in economics at the University of Valladolid and spent the 2021–2022 academic year as a visiting PhD student at the University of Verona. After completing my first year of coursework, I transferred to my current PhD program to focus more intensively on statistical methodology. During my studies, I undertook an extended research visit at the University of Malaya during the 2024–2025 academic year, where I initiated several research projects and collaborations, strengthened through my participation and presentations at conferences held in China.

TEACHINGI have experience tutoring at both undergraduate and graduate levels in international academic settings, including BSc-level Macroeconomics at AGH University in Kraków and MSc-level Econometrics at the University of Verona.

RESEARCH INTERESTS

Methodology

  • Score-Driven Models — Developing and applying for macroeconomic and financial time series analysis.
  • State‑Space Models (Kalman Filtering) — Implementing for the estimation of latent macroeconomic components.
  • Financial Econometrics and Volatility Modeling — Constructing score-driven GARCH-type models using high-frequency data to analyze market volatility.

Empirical Applications

  • Monetary Policy — Inflation dynamics, transmission mechanism and transmission channels.
  • Financial sector and the real economy — Risk attitude, risk appetite and uncertainty.
  • Speculative Bubbles — Focus on the housing market, real exchange rate behavior, and the stock market.

Planned Research on Methodological Advancements

  • Structural Vector Autoregressive (SVAR) models
  • Quantile Regression

  • The Effects of Monetary Policy on House Prices in Spain: The Role of Economic and Monetary Union Membership in the Housing Bubble
    Pál, Tibor. Central European Review of Economics and Management, June 1, 2018.
